alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 5:09PM PDT until July 30 at 8:15PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The El Dorado Fire burn scar in... San Bernardino County in southern California... * Until 815 PM PDT. * At 509 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the El Dorado Fire Burn Scar. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.75 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flows. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the El Dorado Fire Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the El Dorado Fire Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hwy 38 Between Yucaipa And Onyx Summit, Seven Oaks and Barton Flats Campground. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.75-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the El Dorado Fire Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
